data.text:
The luxury yacht market is expected to witness significant growth in the future due to the increase in recreational tourism worldwide, change in lifestyle of people and high net worth individuals and flourishing tourism industry and increasing yacht ownership. The Global Luxury Yacht market size was valued at $7,185.93 Million in 2024 and is projected to reach $10,663.76 Million by 2030. Know More: https://lnkd.in/gsMnshbc Key Players: Ferretti Group Azimut|Benetti Group Sanlorenzo Yacht Feadship Princess Yachts FR. In a world where the sea has been a path for adventurers for millennia, how does one redefine this legacy with modern luxury? What does it mean to set sail not just for destinations, but for a new standard of maritime elegance? How does it feel to be part of a journey that intertwines the thrill of discovery with the pinnacle of comfort and style? Embrace this fusion of heritage and luxury with a yachting experience that charts a new course in seafaring history. #boatiquestaffing #boatiquestaffing2024 #SeafaringLegacy #ModernElegance #LuxuryYachting

What would it be like to experience a day in the life of the world's most privileged travelers? How does it feel to wake up to the gentle lapping of waves against a luxury yacht, where every detail exudes sophistication? Can you picture yourself sipping champagne on a sun-drenched deck, the ocean stretching endlessly before you? Step into the realm of luxury yachting and turn these visions into your reality. #boatiquestaffing #boatiquestaffing2024 #EliteSailing #LuxuriousLife #YachtDreams #LuxuryYachting

Who is building the superyacht giants? Here is an overview of the global distribution of superyacht shipyards that specialise in constructing vessels surpassing the 70-meter mark, a benchmark that distinguishes the elite in yacht craftsmanship. Dominating the chart is Lürssen, a German shipyard renowned for its bespoke luxury yachts, boasting 62 masterpieces that affirm its top-tier status. The chart shows the prowess of European shipbuilders in this top-tier market but also highlights a niche segment; just 2.8% of superyachts exceed the 70-meter luxury threshold, illustrating the exclusivity and grandeur associated with these floating wonders. Lürssen Feadship Oceanco Amels B.V. ABEKING & RASMUSSEN Schiffs- und Yachtwerft SE The Italian Sea Group S.p.A NOBISKRUG Turquoise Yachts Benetti Yachts Blohm+Voss B.V. & Co. Navigating the Future of Yachting: As we anticipate the Cannes Yachting Festival and Monaco Yacht Show, the industry is witnessing a paradigm shift. Revolutionary designs, cutting-edge technologies, and a strong emphasis on sustainability are redefining luxury at sea. Notable trends include the rise of electric and hybrid yachts, sustainable onboard practices, and a changing demographic with a younger clientele. As Asia emerges as a key market, and Gen Z's influence grows, we delve into the noteworthy developments of 2023, shaping the future of yachting. https://lnkd.in/gUJ_d_RD

Who is building the superyacht giants? Here is an overview of the global distribution of superyacht shipyards that specialise in constructing vessels surpassing the 70-meter mark. According to BOAT International Media database, dominating the chart is Lürssen, a German shipyard renowned for its bespoke luxury yachts, boasting an impressive 62 yachts over 70m. The chart shows the prowess of European shipbuilders in this top-tier market but also highlights a niche segment; just 2.8% of superyachts exceed the 70-meter luxury threshold, illustrating the exclusivity and grandeur associated with these floating wonders. Are you surprised by this Lürssen Feadship Oceanco Amels B.V. “Wow, very interesting and a great overview of the market. Really, well done! I had a wonderful few hours reading through the report and have just reread it this evening. The report give an excellent insight into exactly how many yachts are available in the Dutch-built market.” Want to learn more about the sales numbers of 2023? Our annual Dutch-built yacht sales report is now available! The 184 page, data report on Dutch-built yachts larger than 18 meters offers a detailed examination of the international Dutch-built yacht sales market. Here you will find in-depth information about the number of yachts that have been sold, entered the market, changed in price, and have been withdrawn from the sales market. We will compare the data of 2023 with 2022, and analyze some data even over the course of 5 years to see if we can recognize any trends in how the market behaved.
